conclusion: Understand how position and size of shadows change when light source moves forward.
Light source is positioned above objects, casting shadows A, B, C, and D.
Shadows are formed by projection of objects onto ground.
Moving light source forward changes its position relative to objects and ground.
Change in angle of light affects direction and length of shadows.
Shadows will move backward on the ground if light source moves forward.
Shadows will generally become smaller as light source moves forward.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will move backward and become smaller.
